result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew E. Krech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew E. Krech is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew E. Krech was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are paid through DOC.

Provide DNA sample during incarceration if possible, otherwise it must be completed during term of ES.
Mandatory identification procedures (fingerprints/photographs) during incarceration if possible, otherwise it must be completed during term of ES.
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 
Eligible for the earned release program immediately but cannot be released until 75% of sentence has been completed. 
0 days presentence credit.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence being served.

records.addlTxt: 11:05 AM Defendant Andrew E. Krech appeared by video, in custody at Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Andrew E. Krech.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#1, dismiss Ct#2. 4 years 1 day prison; 1 year 1 day initial incarceration followed by 3 years ES: concurrent to current sentence: court costs ($518). 0 days credit. Atty Satorius and Def agree. Court goes over Def's right to appear in person; Def waives that right and wishes to proceed via zoom. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#1.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty of Ct#1 and dismisses Ct#2. DA Hatch and Atty Satorius address sentencing. Court orders 4 years 1 day prison w/1 year 1 day initial incarceration followed by 3 years ES; concurrent to any other sentence beng serving: court costs ($518), Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 0 presentence credit. Mandatory identification procedures: fingerprints/photographs- must be completed prior during the sentence term. Provide DNA sample within 30 days.  Eligible for the earned release program immediately but cannot be released until 75% of sentence has been completed. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Kim M. from SCI advised they cannot make Status Conference set for tomorrow work.  Clerk emailed attorneys to advise and requested they r/s w/JA and SCI.

4:13 PM Attorney Travis Satorius in Court for Andrew E. Krech.  District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Court notes off-record discussion; Atty. Satorius advised of contact with Defendant's Mother and COVID outbreak at Stanley where Defendant was involved.  Plea r/s.  All parties may appear remotely via Zoom.  Court requests Atty. Satorius to contact facility to ensure that date/time work.  Atty. Satorius advises re: Plea Questionnaire, Court advises.  Adjourned at 4:15 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. Defendant pleas NG. Counsel would like to set a plea hearing. Bond remains in its present form. Court adjourned at 2:13 pm.

2:05 PM Defendant Andrew E. Krech appears in court, in custody from Stanley Correctional via zoom,  Atty Travis Satorius, DA Halle E. Hatch appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Satorius states this will be a waiver. Court questions and reviews DE's rights. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:33 AM Defendant Andrew E. Krech appeared by Zoom videoconferencing from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Andrew E. Krech.  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of rights.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  State requests signature bond in the amount of $10,000.  No contact with J.W.T. or his residence or properties.  No contact with co-defendant, J.M.R.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy preliminary hearing, Defendant requests w/in 20 days.  Court directs Defendant to have prints/photos done in facility if available.  If not he needs to have them done within 30 days of release.  Preliminary Hearing set and confirmed w/Records at facility.  Court questions Defendant and advises of his right to appear in person.  Defendant waives personal appearance.  Adjourned at 9:46 AM
